qas.question: What are international tribunals and arbiters often called upon to resolve in regards to treaties?
What judicial bodies might be called upon to resolve disputes pertaining to the interpretation of treaties?
In addition to the final, signed treaty what else might arbiters review to establish the meaning of a treaty in context?

answers.text: the preparatory work from the negotiation and drafting of the treaty

qas.question: For what purpose might an international tribunal review the preparatory work from the negotiation and drafting of a treaty?

answers.text: To establish the meaning in context

qas.question: In addition to the preparatory work from the drafting and negotiation of a treaty, what might arbiters review when resolving a dispute over the interpretation of a treaty?

context: <a1_0>International tribunals and arbiters<a1_0/> are often called upon to resolve <a0_0>substantial disputes over treaty interpretations<a0_0/>. <a3_0>To establish the meaning in context<a3_0/>, these judicial bodies may review <a2_0>the preparatory work from the negotiation and drafting of the treaty<a2_0/> as well as <a4_0>the final, signed treaty itself<a4_0/>.
